docs.text: in " twilight , " a ex-alcoholic , ex-cop , ex-husband , ex-private-eye , harry ross ( paul newman ) , works for a pair of aging hollywood actors , catherine ( susan sarandon ) and jack ames ( gene hackman ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jack is being blackmailed , and he asks harry to deliver the payoff .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead of the blackmailers , harry finds a dying ex-cop ( m .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: emmet walsh ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as more bodies begin to pile up , harry realizes that he will have to solve the disappearance of catherine's first husband twenty years earlier to find out who's willing to kill to keep that secret buried .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: newman . sarandon .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hackman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with an a-list cast of oscar laureates like that , " twilight " would seem very promising .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , the script is tired and predictable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it would serve well as a tv-movie-of-the-week , possibly with some 1970's detective hero reprising his role .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the appeal of the project for its stars and its director , robert benton , is nostalgia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " twilight " wants very much to be a 1940's film noir with alan ladd or dick powell .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all of the standard tropes are here : a hard-boiled p . i .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: among the rich and beautiful whose glamour hides sinister secrets , a femme fatale who tempts and confounds the hero , shadowy figures shooting from doorways , dead bodies confronting the hero at every turn , cops dogging his path and interfering with his investigation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script offers little originality , and co-authors benton and richard russo seem unaware that what was original in 1948 is a clich ? in 1998 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: elmer bernstein's score is hauntingly melodic and could have been drawn note-for-note from a vintage noir .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the lead actors try hard-none of the three has every made less than a full effort , even when burdened with a bad script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they try to invest every line and gesture with meaning , and they create a convincing sense of the relationships between the main characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: harry is fond of jack but is in love with catherine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jack is dying of cancer and is jealous of harry's love for catherine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: catherine teases harry and enjoys his attention , but her real feelings are hidden beneath a carefully-maintained veneer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " twilight " wants to be character-driven like " nobody's fool " ( also directed by benton , also starring newman , based on a novel by russo ) was , but the tired script gives the actors too little to work with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " twilight " also squanders a fine supporting cast : stockard channing ( harry's friend on the police force ) , reese witherspoon ( jack & catherine's bratty kid ) , giancarlo esposito ( the humorous sidekick ) , john spencer ( harry's nemesis on the force ) , liev schreiber and margo martindale ( the blackmailers ) , and james garner ( a cop who bailed movie stars out of trouble ) .
docs.label: negative
